page.title: 01CHILMARK AND TEFFONT
page.content:
{ Chilmark and Teffont Magna}are both villages on the northern edge of the {Nadder Valley,}both clustered round streams which flow south into the Nadder, and thus into the{Avon}at {Salisbury.}The Chilmark stream is a true{winterbourne, dry}between May and November.The Teffont stream flows all the year. Both villages are situated where the {Chalklands of Salisbury Plain}to the north meet the older clays and lime- stones to the south. Chilmark is much the bigger of the two with a{population of nearly five {hundred,}but{Teffont Magna}is only half a village. The other half,Teffont Evias, is outside the survey area.
AMcG
